title: Senate Takes Up Trump’s Policy Bill, as G.O.P. Scrounges for Votes to Pass It
summary: Republican leaders barely scaled a key procedural hurdle to bring up the bill, but Democrats delayed its consideration and it was unclear whether the G.O.P. had the votes to pass it.

title: Musk Wades Back Into Politics, Slamming Trump’s Domestic Policy Bill
summary: Weeks after ending his war of words with President Trump, Elon Musk called the president’s bill “utterly insane and destructive.”

title: Why a G.O.P. Medicaid Requirement Could Set States Up for Failure
summary: The Republicans’ big bill would require most states to build technology systems quickly and with little funding.

title: How the Supreme Court’s Injunction Ruling Expands Trump’s Power
summary: The court tied the hands of judges at a time when Congress has been cowed and internal executive branch constraints have been steamrolled.

title: Chief Justice Roberts Urges Political Leaders to Tone Down Rhetoric
summary: At a conference with federal judges, the chief justice did not mention the court’s decision sharply limiting their power, focusing instead on the danger of threats to the judiciary.

title: Israel and U.S. Smashed Iran Nuclear Site That Grew After Trump Quit 2015 Accord
summary: Nuclear experts say the president’s rejection of the restrictive deal forced him to neutralize an Iranian threat of his own making.

title: Iran Holds State Funeral for Military Commanders and Nuclear Scientists
summary: A procession of marchers honored prominent figures killed during the 12-day war with Israel.

title: How Europe Got Tough on Migration
summary: The European Union has not gone as far as President Trump in cracking down on immigration, but its shift is already profound.

title: Chess Lover Introduces Game to Malawi’s Prisons, Schools and Street Kids
summary: Susan Namangale fell in love with the game at age 9 in her small village, and she’s now on a mission to deliver a message to the whole country: Chess is good for everyone.

title: Is Pope Leo a Man of Action on Sexual Abuse Cases? Or the Opposite?
summary: For some survivors, he was a hero. Others who reported abuse said he failed them.

title: Takeaways From a Times Investigation of the Pope’s Legacy on Sex Abuse
summary: As a bishop in Peru, Pope Leo XIV’s handling of two abuse cases was a study in contrasts, siding strongly with victims in one and accused of failing them in the other.

title: Tim Walz Eulogizes Minnesota Rep. Melissa Hortman and Husband During Funeral
summary: Melissa Hortman was eulogized by Gov. Tim Walz as a compassionate leader in a service that former President Biden and former Vice President Harris also attended.

title: Political Violence Is Part of the American Story. It Is Also Changing.
summary: Attacks, such as an assassination in Minnesota, are on the rise. Their motives are often hard to parse.

title: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan Narrow CZI’s Focus to Science Efforts
summary: The tech titan and his wife once had sprawling ambitions for their Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. Now their efforts in politics, education and housing have been cut back to focus on science.

title: The Times’s New Critic Reviews the View, the Revolving Times Square Restaurant
summary: In her first review as our new critic, Ligaya Mishan checks out the View, the revolving Times Square dining room with a nostalgic menu and a stunning panorama of the city.

title: Is Mostafa Asal, Squash World Champion, Testing The Rules, or Cheating?
summary: Even Mostafa Asal’s coach admits his player sometimes goes too far. But an anonymous YouTuber is crying foul play, with videos to make the point.

title: America Can’t Do to North Korea What It Just Did to Iran
summary: The Trump administration should embrace a North Korea strategy that aims to contain escalation, not keep a white-knuckled grip on a failed policy.

title: Obfuscating on Obliterating
summary: Trump schools the Ayatollah on the fine art of truth telling.

title: Zohran Mamdani Returns to Harlem to Make His Pitch to Black New Yorkers
summary: The presumptive Democratic nominee for mayor, who has struggled to make inroads with the Black community, spoke at the Rev. Al Sharpton’s National Action Network on Saturday.

title: Golden Arches in a War Zone: McDonald’s Thrives in Ukraine
summary: The American fast-food giant plans to open about 10 new restaurants in Ukraine this year, a testament to the country’s rebounding economy and its enduring love of Big Macs.

title: Democrats Cheer Hollywood Tax Breaks They Once Called ‘Corporate Welfare’
summary: California politicians once derided a $50 million proposal by Arnold Schwarzenegger. With the support of unions, they’re now strongly backing a $750 million subsidy.

title: Mikayla Raines, Who Rescued Foxes and Other Animals, Is Dead at 30
summary: She founded Save a Fox Rescue to care for foxes that had been abandoned or bred for their pelts on fur farms. She gained millions of social media followers along the way.
